column3: after she had been queen for over a year
column4: Victoria was formally crowned at Westminster Abbey. The crown worn by her predecessors was far too large for her
column5: so a new crown was made at a cost of over five hundred thousand dollars. The spectacle was a most impressive and inspiring one
column6: and the queen went through her part in it
column7: as she had gone through her part at all ceremonies in which she had participated
column8: in a manner which roused anew the enthusiasm of her subjects. When the prime minister finally placed the crown on Victoria's head
column9: all the peers and peeresses placed their coronets on their heads and shouted God Save the Queen. Carlyle said of her at that time
column10: "Poor little Queen! She is at an age at which a girl can hardly be trusted to choose a bonnet for herself
column11: yet a task is laid upon her from which an archangel might shrink."
